document.heading: Alternative Money Lending and Services Reform Amendment Act of 2010

history.narrative: Law 18-315, the “Alternative Money Lending and Services Reform Amendment Act of 2010”, was introduced in Council and assigned Bill No. 18-715, which was referred to the Committee on Public Services and Consumer Affairs. The Bill was adopted on first and second readings on November 9, 2010, and November 23, 2010, respectively. Signed by the Mayor on December 9, 2010, it was assigned Act No. 18-636 and transmitted to both Houses of Congress for its review. D.C. Law 18-315 became effective on March 12, 2011.
